title: Citi cleans up IMF raising with shortfall auction
text:
Citi's equities desk is in the market with a small parcel of shares in IMF Bentham on Wednesday afternoon.

The broker was calling for bids for 1.7 million rights left over from the institutional portion of IMF's equity raising.

Citi was calling for bids at the $3.40 a share offer price.

The auction was slated to close at 4pm Wednesday, according to terms sent to fund managers.

It comes after IMF received institutional bids for shares in its $139 million equity offer. The deal was structured as a $120 million non-renounceable rights issue and $19 million share placement.
